Allow to create new issues from PDE Errors view would make easier to report issues about plugins. Mylar can use exception and error details to query repository for similar issues and populate issue details when nothing is found.

BTW, Subversive plugin has interesting feature of similar nature. Once logged error has reference to subversive packages it is offering to send an email with error details to the plugin vendor.
*** Bug 120430 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Yes, we've wanted to do this for a some time now, and it will be very straightforward.

I also wonder if we should have the bugs.eclipse.org repository added by default (or make it one-click to add) to enable easier submission of Eclipse and Mylar bugs.

I think that the one click add is a great idea since that is one of the first repositories that i normally add.  It will need to include getting the user name and password from the user though since this is required to submit a bug

(In reply to comment #2)
> I also wonder if we should have the bugs.eclipse.org repository added by
> default (or make it one-click to add) to enable easier submission of Eclipse
> and Mylar bugs.

I think this would make sense.

As of specifying user and password Mylar should bring up a user/passwrd dialog when trying to access repository with no credential. That would be similar to what CVS/SVN plugins do.

As part of this, we should also optionally allow the last n events of the interaction history to be submitted as an attachment, since this kind of thing can be a huge help with debugging (note Eugene's comment on bug 138756).  We can use the usual SHA-based obfuscation to ensure privacy.

I've done some experimenting with the contribution to the error log view, but I was having trouble detecting which element was selected when the action was invoked (with the ViewerContribution). I wasn't able to get an ObjectContribution to register the option in the context menu. I'll look at it again, once I have the UI issue worked out the rest should be pretty simple to put together.

Check out how OpenWithBrowserAction extends BaseSelectionListenerAction and see if that approach works, since that prevents needing to get at the viewer to get the selection.  Let me know if it doesn't.

Mik, the BaseSelectionListener didn't work for me since it needs to implement IViewActionDelegate (or ObjectDelegate) to be registered with another plug-in's view. However I did find a way to register a listener with the Log view when the action is initialized.

The bad news is that the object which is selected in the Log is an internal class 'org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogEntry'. The only way we can implement this feature is to use the internal class AFAIK.

Why don't you make an objectContribution (e.g. refer to mylar.tasklist's) for LogEntry?  That will get you the selection for free.  It's OK for now that this is an internal class, but we should consider asking Platform/PDE to make that class (or a new interface) API before marking this report resolved.

I can't get an objectContribution to show up in the Error Logs context menu, perhaps I'm doing something wrong. The same action shows up with a viewerContribution to the LogView. I've tried with and without the menubar path as well.

It is possible that the view is not accepting objectContributions, but that would be lame and warrant another bug report to Platform/PDE.  How are they adding their own popup contributions, via code?

Whichever way you get it going is fine, and if I can think of a simpler way of doing it I'll comment when reviewing.  Fyi we have a mechanism for registering part activations in Mylar, but try to avoid having to use the if possible, if not ask and I'll point you at it.

Regarding comment#15, let's keep this really simple and similar to the Error Log formatting, and I think your proposal is pretty much there.  
  - <type>: "<message>" in <plug-in>
  - Error: "No route to host: connect" in org.eclipse.mylar.core

Then for the Description remove the all caps and keep what you have.  But put a "\n-- Error Log --" on top of it to indicate that it is automatic and to encourage people to add a note above that.

Since NewTaskFromErrorAction depends on org.eclipse.pde.runtime, I moved it into mylar.ide.  Having it in mylar.tasks.ui prevents the Task List from installing in an Eclipse configuration that does not include PDE (e.g. the Callisto Platfrom runtime or an RCP app).
